Authors: Arifin Y., Sastria T.G., Barlian E.
Title: User Experience Metric for Augmented Reality Application: A Review
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Game Application and Technology Program, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Arifin, Y., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sastria, T.G., Game Application and Technology Program, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Barlian, E., Game Application and Technology Program, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Augmented Reality Technology is developing rapidly and has been widely used in the field of education. Due to the ease of developing AR by non-professionals, User Experience (UX) is often not considered in the application. Currently, there are no standard measurements of UX for AR applications especially in Education. The authors reviewed previous research to obtain UX references and the existing measurement standards. From the results of the review, the metrics were analyzed based on the characteristics of AR, especially in the field of education. The metrics will be recommended for the UX measurement of an AR application. The available standard metrics can be used to determine the UX quality of an AR application and contribute to the improvement of UX in AR applications, especially in the field of Education. © 2018 The Authors. Published by Elsevier Ltd.
Author Keywords: arithmetic word problem; intelligent humanoid robot; natural language processing; question answering system
Index Keywords: Anthropomorphic robots; Artificial intelligence; Augmented reality; Engineering education; Intelligent robots; Augmented reality applications; Augmented reality technology; Intelligent humanoid robots; Measurement standards; Question answering systems; Standard measurements; User experiences (ux); Word problem; Natural language processing systems
